section: CUSTOMERS means all users who access Co-Branded Site and complete at least one transaction per month.
explanation: The definition of 'Customers' requires them to complete at least one transaction *per month*. This is an unusual and restrictive definition, as it implies someone ceases to be a customer if they don't transact every month. This is an Ambiguity in text, because it does not explain what will happen if a customer does not access the Co-Branded site for one month.

section: In the event that the parties are unable to agree to an SOW within 2 months following the Effective Date, either party may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement by providing written notice.
explanation: This section creates an ambiguity in text. The effective date is defined as June 21, 1999. Two months following this date would be August 21, 1999. The document date indicates 8/26/1999. If the parties were unable to agree to the SOW by August 21, 1999, then how does it make sense for the agreement to be documented 5 days later?

section: The formula for arriving at the per Transaction Inquiry amount may be revised from time to time during the term of this Agreement to reflect present market conditions ("the Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual consent of the parties after good faith discussions. The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an addendum to this Agreement.
explanation: There is an inconsistency in text because if there is an adjusted rate, then that addendum is not added to this agreement.
